title: YouTuber Marzia Kjellberg shares update following gruesome injury
text:
Marzia injured herself while on honeymoon (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

YouTuber Marzia Kjellberg has shared an update after she injured her toe while on her second honeymoon with PewDiePie last week.

The influencer managed to cut her toe in bloody scenes after she dropped an extremely sharp knife on her foot.

Amid gorgeous photos from the trip away, the 26-year-old shared a snap of a pesky knife, writing: ‘I was opening the packaging for this knife and it slid out and landed tip first vertically onto my bare toe. Not fun. Lots of blood.’

Giving her fans some sound advice, she added: ‘Just a reminder to be careful while handling knives.’

As worried followers began to hound her for an update after she revealed the horrible injury, she’s now taken to social media to set the record straight after trying to appease us with updates over the weekend.

Turns out she’s on the mend and we can all go back to our day now.

Sharing a cute cartoon drawing of what her toe might look like IRL, the 26-year-old doodled her digit with a big smile on its face.

‘I see lots of questions about my toe so here it is today,’ she wrote, with a winking emoji.

‘It’s definitely getting better and I’m totally fine so no need to worry.’

Ouch (Picture: Instagram)

She added sweetly: ‘Thank you all for the concern’.

Earlier on over the weekend she tried to let us know she was fine as she wrote: ‘Thank you all for worrying about the toe. It is a very dark purple colour near the cut, so it’s not looking pretty BUT I’ve been able to walk all day so I assume it’s not that serious. I’m hoping it will heal on its own.’

Don’t handle knives, to be on the safe side (Picture: itsmarziapie)

Terrifying knife accidents aside, the pair seem to be having a blast in Japan, which is where they got engaged back in 2018.

Marzia shared some stunning snaps of the streets of Tokyo, the gorgeous landscape at night, as well as a couple of her new husband.

‘I’m enjoying experiencing autumn in Tokyo for the first time…it is much warmer than you would expect!’ she wrote.

Meanwhile 29-year-old Pewds – real name Felix Kjellberg – showed off his silly side as he got his groove on with a street performer.

Holding a ragged Barbie doll, the YouTuber danced along with a performer who appeared to be creating some sort of illusion as he wore a ‘wind-swept’ tie.

Laughter could be heard in the background as Felix slowly danced towards the performer, who dramatically lunged at the doll, which looked a little worse for wear, and embraced it.

It seems the pair are having a blast on their second honeymoon after they tied the knot at London’s Kew Gardens a month ago.
